name: Satoshi Motoyama
introduction: Satoshi Motoyama ( - Motoyama Satoshi; born 4 March, 1971 in Tokyo, Japan) is a Japanese racing driver who was a test driver for the Jordan team in the early 2000's. He is best known for his illustrious career in the Japanese Super GT series, in which he won three GT500 class championships in 2003, 2004 and 2008 while driving for Nismo (Nissan's motorsports division), and won 16 races in the GT500 class. He also won four championships in Formula Nippon (now known as Super Formula), becoming one of the greatest Japanese racing drivers of all-time.
